title: fix: handle absent strand information
body:
### Description

Currently varlociraptor fails when the strand information is absent in the strand-information-string.
Absent strand information is represented by `.`.
As the `Strand`-enum already contains `None` as possible object handling of the absent information only has the be added to the `from_aux_item`-function.

### QC
<!-- Make sure that you can tick the boxes below. -->

* [x] The PR contains a test case for the changes or the changes are already covered by an existing test case.
* [x] The documentation at https://github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor.github.io is updated in a separate PR to reflect the changes or this is not necessary (e.g. if the change does neither modify the calling grammar nor the behavior or functionalities of Varlociraptor).

title: fix: sort events by probability for more informative VCF INFO field order
body:
### Description

This PR sorts resulting event probabilities such that they are ordered by descending probability in the final BCF. This allows identifying the event with largest probability easily with a quick glance (with bcftools view).
We could also order by event name instead, such that the info fields are in a consistent (instead of informative) order.
The main point here is that the order is no longer arbitrary.

### QC
<!-- Make sure that you can tick the boxes below. -->

* [x] The PR contains a test case for the changes or the changes are already covered by an existing test case.
* [x] The documentation at https://github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor.github.io is updated in a separate PR to reflect the changes or this is not necessary (e.g. if the change does neither modify the calling grammar nor the behavior or functionalities of Varlociraptor).

title: fix: use pseudo observation to adjust MAPQ for lower depths
body:
### Description

This adds some additional uncertainty to low depth loci. This is important, because at low depth, we might accidentally miss low MAPQ reads and all observed reads could have an artificially inflated MAPQ by random sequencing errors. By adding a pseudo observation with reduced MAPQ, this missing uncertainty is efficiently introduced, while becoming more and more important the lower the depth is.

### QC
<!-- Make sure that you can tick the boxes below. -->

* [x] The PR contains a test case for the changes or the changes are already covered by an existing test case.
* [x] The documentation at https://github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor.github.io is updated in a separate PR to reflect the changes or this is not necessary (e.g. if the change does neither modify the calling grammar nor the behavior or functionalities of Varlociraptor).

## [4.6.0](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/compare/v4.5.0...v4.6.0) (2021-11-02)


### Features

* better homopolymer error detection ([#226](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/issues/226)) ([b95d03d](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/commit/b95d03d99519cb00c0a59aa61ab834a56e5f3777))
* eliminate false positives and false negatives: MAPQ adjustment (adjust MAPQ by mean pileup MAPQ; this gets rid of stochastically inflated MAPQs), do not estimate strand bias if all reads come from the same strand, infer wildtype forward strand rate from non-alt reads if possible ([#222](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/issues/222)) ([d54ccb0](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/commit/d54ccb07b02788d026ee1defe540a84587d63998))


### Bug Fixes

* properly handle reads with both allele probs -inf ([6b04fd6](https://www.github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor/commit/6b04fd6a118524eb27ba469309c620771e4a7760))
---

body:
### Description

This PR ensures that two consecutive regions in the candidate region merging step are actually in the correct order.
This also adds the word "sorted" to the cli help text in front of "VCF/BCF".

I'll leave this as a draft because there's no test for this, yet.

title: feat: overhauled somatic prior: the effective mutation rate serves for deciding between somatic VAF 0.0 and >0.0, beyond, a flat distribution is assumed
body:
### Description

The effective mutation rate now defines the expected fraction of sites with somatic VAF > 0.0. The a priori expectation of the height of the VAF is now uniformly distributed. This improves better resembles intuition when setting the prior assumptions. Further, it avoids cases where higher somatic VAFs becomes so unlikely that suddenly the model assumed germline mutations even against the evidence in e.g. a normal sample.

### QC
<!-- Make sure that you can tick the boxes below. -->

* [x] The PR contains a test case for the changes or the changes are already covered by an existing test case.
* [x] The documentation at https://github.com/varlociraptor/varlociraptor.github.io is updated in a separate PR to reflect the changes or this is not necessary (e.g. if the change does neither modify the calling grammar nor the behavior or functionalities of Varlociraptor).

title: feat: added VAF log fold change and comparison operators to the scenario event grammar
body:
### Description

This PR adds comparison expressions using `==`, `<`, `>`, `!=`, `<=`, `>=`for comparison between sample VAFs to the grammar, as well as an expression `lfc(sample_a, sample_b)` for defining constraints on the log fold change of VAFs between samples.

title: refactor!: Rename estimate tmb subcommand into estimate mutational-burden
body: since the plots have been generalized to non tumor samples.

title: docs: reorder modes in readme
WES testcases and improved MNV and SNV handling in case of overlapping indels.
body: For reads with indel operations, we now realign against the MNV or SNV allele and the reference instead of just looking at the altered bases. This prevents FPs and deviations from the true VAF.

title: Scatter/Contour plot functionality
body: A function to plot a scatter plot with an overlaying contour plot between two sample groups. Multiple samples can be plotted against one fixed sample.

title: fix: merging of VAFRanges
body:
The merge of two `VAFRange`s in `FormulaTerminal` which was supposed to result in the intersection (i.e. conjunction) of the two ranges but actually resulted in the union (i.e. disjunction). 
This PR fixes that behaviour for merging conjunctions.
However, there may also be certain disjunction cases (such as overlapping ranges) which ought to be merged when normalizing, e.g. `normal:[0.0, 0.5] | normal:[0.5, 1.0]` can be merged to `normal[0.0,1.0]`. I'll hence leave this as a draft for now.

title: Fix compiler warning
body:
Analog to [this one at rust-bio](https://github.com/rust-bio/rust-bio/pull/430#event-4805686901), just with the `panic!` macro:

> Just a quick fix of for `#[warn(non_fmt_panic)]`. Looks like the `format!` macro should be avoided inside the `assert!` >as shown [here](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.assert.html#custom-messages) in the example for custom error >messages with `assert!`.

title: Local fdr and variant type specific mutation rate factors.
body:
This PR enables to control local FDR (`--local`). Additionally, it activates variant type specific mutation rate reduction factors (0.1 for indels, 0.001 for MNVs, 0.01 for SVs). They can be specified via the grammar:

```
species:
  variant-fractions:
    indel: 0.0125
    mnv: 0.001
    sv: 0.001
```
Above are the hardcoded defaults, which are derived from the literature. This is of course very rough, but it is only a prior assumption anyway.

title: update changelog with decode-phred bug-fix
decode_phred: ensure quoting of description in changed header lines
body: Otherwise, descriptions containing commas will lead to invalid header lines, as commas will be interpreted as field separators in the header line.

title: Automatically anonymize testcases
body:
This
* replaces read names with uuids
* replaces sequences in reads reference and alleles with a random permutation (of course the same for all three types).
* replaces any paths in the recorded preprocessing options with "?"

Also, unnecessary header records are removed now.

title: inheritance handling for arbitrary ploidies, proper consideration of VAFs in case of ploidy==0
Add softclip bias
body: By that, we get rid of the filtering of softclipped reads when calling SNVs and MNVs, that could previously cause deviations from expected read depth and in rare cases could have also masked SNVs that were in phase with SVs #165. Softclip bias avoids such situations, while still being able to avoid softclip induced artifacts. Similar to all other biases, it is accumulated in the PROB_ARTIFACT event probability.

title: omit unlikely biases by just looking at the observations
testcase for complex scenario, fix for sex chromosome inheritance
implement BDD based simplification, and automatic referral of events
Add simple observations, sort observations by evidence type (N vs not N)
body: Testcase for mendelian inheritance.

title: Add ready-to-code option with gitpod
body:
[gitpod](https://gitpod.io/workspaces/) itself supplies a pretty good summary for this PR:
> This PR implements a fully-automated development setup using Gitpod.io, an
> online IDE for GitLab, GitHub, and Bitbucket that enables Dev-Environments-As-Code.
> This makes it easy for anyone to get a ready-to-code workspace for any branch,
> issue or pull request almost instantly with a single click.

The dependencies needed for tests (i.e. samtools) are contained in a pre-built environment with the name `varlociraptor` that is automatically activated in the first opened terminal. When opening a new terminal you can activate the environment manually with `micromamba activate varlociraptor`.

title: use hashing instead of ordering for checking and caching events
add small deletion tumor-normal test case
body: Thanks @nh13 for providing this test case in issue #154!

title: Fix prior cache
body: Avoids an endless filling of the prior cache for complex scenarios.

title: TMB plots for multiple samples
body:
This PR seeks to enhance the TMB plotting functionality towards a multi-sample barplot. 
 - Vartypes have been reduced to Signatures (T>C falls under the same category as A>G etc.), but the original code is still present - maybe it can be an optional choice which representation to use.
- For visibility, TMB in the multi-sample plot is shown for a minimal VAF value which can be chosen as a parameter.

This is just a first functional version to get a quick representation of multiple samples side by side.

title: do not push bias event if no bias was selected
do not generate right breakend if replacement ends at the right end of a contig.
Support for obtaining read orientation from BAM tag `RO:Z`
better error messages, fix expression usage in varlociraptor formulas.
implement read position bias
body:
In addition:
* speedup bias estimation by not anymore considering combinations of biases.
* add a prior for biases compared to no biases (0.5 / 0.5), and an internal uniform prior for all considered biases.
* skip biases that cannot be observed.
* special case skipping for read orientation bias in case there is no direct observation of the orientation at question from any ALT read pair.
* code cleanup and refactoring

title: Implement a universal, configurable prior
implement support for aux per base strand information
adapt to htslib 0.35
allow ignoring strand bias and read orientation bias
body:
This PR introduces the flags `--omit-strand-bias` and `--omit-read-orientation-bias` and handles them accordingly.

@johanneskoester Currently, this does not include a test for either of them or both of them being set. Should I simply create a test case for each based on the version in this branch?

title: Remove ability to parallelize varlociraptor via threads.
body:
The reason is that this generates too much overhead and often fails to saturate all given cores.
Instead, we now promote to use varlociraptor in scatter/gather style, in combination with
rbt vcf-split.

title: allow definition of re-usable expressions in scenario
Fix transition probs in pathhmm
Fast realignments with approximation of pairHMM by just looking at the best alignment path.
Use precomputed base miscall and call likelihoods.
body: This is slightly faster than calculating them on the fly.

title: remove possibility of using alignment_properties.insert_size when it is None
body:
When running varlociraptor on some single end read data, I got this panic!() that I had put there a while ago:
```
AlignmentProperties has insert_size set to `None`, but you are trying to use it without checking for None.This is a bug.
```

The backtrace indicates, that the problem is in `varlociraptor::variants::sample::SampleBuilder::alignments()`:
```
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:86
   1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66
   2: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:78
   3: <std::sys_common::backtrace::_print::DisplayBacktrace as core::fmt::Display>::fmt
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59
   4: core::fmt::write
             at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1076
   5: std::io::Write::write_fmt
             at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1537
   6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62
   7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49
   8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:198
   9: std::panicking::default_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:217
  10: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:526
  11: std::panicking::begin_panic
  12: varlociraptor::variants::sample::SampleBuilder::alignments
  13: crossbeam_utils::thread::ScopedThreadBuilder::spawn::{{closure}}
```

But I just removed the `insert_size()` function and replaced it with a public instance of `insert_size` in `AlignmentProperties` and then try to handle every case where an `insert_size` is used. Please feel free to correct any of the behaviour I put there, be it the handling I implemented or the `panic!()`s that I put wherever I had no clue what else to do with a `None` right there.

And one point I still do not get is what the `--omit_insert_size` flag actually does. I don't think that it actually prevents the usage of the `insert_size` information...?!

title: Catch more artifacts
body:
Remove some artifacts:
* do not consider softclipped reads or read pairs with nonstandard orientation when evaluating SNVs or MNVs.

title: Generalize bias handling. Add read orientation bias.
body: This enables us to detect Guanin oxidation errors.

title: Parallelize without sorting of output.
Parallelization via crossbeam.
body: In addition, this PR disables antisense breakend inference, as it turned out that missing breakends are intentional in state of the art callers, see PapenfussLab/gridss/issues/378.

title: Add support for arbitary replacements (e.g. ACCT>ATCTT)
body: Implemented by delegation to internal breakend modeling.

title: Support for single breakends
body: In addition, a minor fix for sampling bias calculating, and refactoring of the breakend code.
